programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigation into a possible alien visitation to England in December 1980, when Air Force personnel claimed they saw strange lights hovering in the sky.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine the link between aliens and the Civil War, exploring Abraham Lincoln's strange visions and ghostly images seen at Gettysburg.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go to Murieta, California, where Jarrod and Brandi hope to turn their recent run of misfortune around.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive bid of his career, and Ivy learns a lesson that radically changes his approach to locker buying.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth intervenes in a confrontation between a customer and an employee in the car park, and is later given a 30th birthday surprise by his colleagues.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A family feud leads to Ashley's resignation. Meanwhile, a couple of women try to sell a dirty fur coat and a man offers to pawn his gold tooth.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator teams up with Daniel Browning Smith to investigate the claims of a man who says he can move objects with his mind.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Three decades after a man was found dead in San Diego, forensic science finally identifies his killer.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Two teams haggle for an Austin 1100 and a Ford Cortina in the hope of making the greater profit after stripping them down to scrap.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth intervenes in a confrontation between a customer and an employee in the car park, and is later given a 30th birthday surprise by his colleagues.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A family feud leads to Ashley's resignation. Meanwhile, a couple of women try to sell a dirty fur coat and a man offers to pawn his gold tooth.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating evidence that suggests the world's governments could be on the verge of announcing everything they know about UFOs.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating whether aliens could be plotting an attack on Earth, and if humans could survive their weapons' terrifying capabilities.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether aliens that once visited Earth deliberately left a series of clues that mankind was eventually meant to decipher. Many ancient sites, and even recent ones like Roswell, all seem to be associated with reports of something coming down from the sky. Tsoukalos' research demonstrates that many of these places share a common symbol or shape-concentric circles. What is the significance of these designs, and is it possible they contain a coded message left by alien visitors?.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The secret military aircraft constructed by armed forces in America, South Africa, Russia, Australia and Canada that resemble flying saucers, and have caused a stir with the locals.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient alien therorists investigate evidence suggesting that extraterrestrials have played a pivotal role in the progress of mankind.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Moreno Valley, California and descend upon auctions at a facility that has been known for great scores.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to hit a high pay-off with a low buy-in while Darrell and Brandon limp into a locker that may leave them all wet.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi's plans go awry as the buyers hit Santa Ana and Dave shows up looking to cause trouble.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene brings his father Gunter to help hunt for collectibles and Ivy takes a gamble for something out of the ordinary.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy is forced to defend his turf or score big with a home field advantage, but it is Mary that cleans up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi lets Jarrod hold the purse strings. However, it is Mary who snags the most expensive locker of the day as the buyers hit California.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit Palm Springs and Dave looks to turn his luck around, while Mary enlists a very unlikely ally.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The One with Mary and Allee
programme.desc: The buyers arrive in Hollywood, where Mary and her new friend Allee resolve to win big by tracking down valuable showbiz-related items.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley plays a prank on Seth to teach him a lesson about locking his door - but Seth evens the score with a practical joke of his own. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When the Golds uncover a series of bogus pawns, their investigation leads to a trusted employee and a confession. Reality series about the running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Seth visit a customer with a garage full of vintage cars. Against his children's wishes, Les offers big money for one of the owner's golden oldies.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With Les and Seth away at the Autorama car show - and Ashley in charge of the store - the employees go a little crazy. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Karen tries to make peace between Seth and Ashley, Bobby J takes a two-story tractor for a spin and a watch snob riles Seth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. A ventriloquist leaves Karen and Bobby J speechless, and an angry mixed martial arts fighter takes a swing at Byron.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Golds' million-dollar art deal takes more twists and turns, but eventually Les shakes hands on the single biggest purchase in store history.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Members of the Gold family open the doors to their huge Detroit pawn shop once again as they encounter intriguing finds and awkward customers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene gets superstitious as he hopes to strike it lucky for a second time at auctions in Fontana, while Ivy goes with his gut.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry sets out to humiliate Ivy, Rene gets a nasty surprise, and Jarrod and Brandi find themselves surrounded by pigs.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The FV-Tuna.com boat remains in the lead but on the Lisa & Jake, Paul has caught three fish and is on target to reach his $50,000 goal.

programme.title: Superheroes Decoded
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at superheroes that challenged authority in battles reflecting real-world divisions and struggles.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The secret military aircraft constructed by armed forces in America, South Africa, Russia, Australia and Canada that resemble flying saucers, and have caused a stir with the locals.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry, including a challenge involving a cement-filled shoebox.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Janey Godley and barrister Robert Rinder joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Cariad Lloyd and Paul Sinha join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig considers various phenomena. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy actress Katherine Parkinson, dance guru Louie Spence, comedian David O'Doherty and breakfast news presenter Bill Turnbull join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. The aim of the game is to hoodwink opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies - like whether Louie makes himself cry before every performance and if David actually is seeing a psychiatrist to cure a strange addiction.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and actor Nigel Havers, while Lee Mack teams up with writer and comedian Charlie Brooker and actress Nina Wadia, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Hal Cruttenden, Ed Gamble and Zoe Lyons. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Racing instructor Aktar has a garage full of cars, and is going to sell them all to buy his 'forever car'. Will it be the American muscle, the German turbos or an English supercar?.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: More thrills, spills, customer carts and crashes in this extreme downhill battle at the Eduardo VII Park in Lisbon.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall, winner of the 2017 World's Strongest Man contest, tours the USA on a quest to conquer the biggest and best eye-watering food and physical challenges. Eddie lands in Florida Keys to attempt a conch-fritter eating record, do some serious big-game fishing and try what's billed as the best Key Lime Pie on earth.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall squares up to the Mac & Cheese Challenge at Brooklyn's Mac Shack - which weighs in at more than two kilograms and nearly 7,000 calories of pasta, cheese and sauce.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a road trip, trying to follow the path of the Three Wise Men across the Middle East. However, they opt to do so in open-top sports cars that were built for significantly less demanding tasks than driving along the conflict-ridden mountains of southern Turkey, through war-ravaged Iraq and across the searing deserts of Syria. The trio also try to find out what myrrh is and where it can be bought.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Compilation of two features on classic cars and SUVs. The presenters immerse themselves in the world of classic cars, with Jeremy Clarkson in a Fiat 124 Spider, Richard Hammond in an MGB GT and James May in a Peugeot 304 Cabriolet. They also enter the realm of the sports utility vehicle as they find out what sort of SUV can be bought for just a few hundred pounds before putting them through a series of challenges.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness take over as the latest hosting team of the motoring show. Their first episode takes them to Ethiopia, where they test cars to see how they can endure in the searing heat. Back at the track, Chris puts the Ferrari 488 Pista and McLaren 600LT through their paces.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with more developed failures.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with longer, more developed failures.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are sent to Bolivia, where they are challenged to travel through the rainforest and journey to the coast of Chile, driving second-hand off-road vehicles bought locally for a maximum of £3,500 each. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the region's roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The weird and wonderful compete in an extreme downhill battle in Cincinnati, Ohio, but who will be victorious?.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Comedians Phill Jupitus and Marcus Brigstocke head to Bolivia for a high-altitude trip, first driving along the infamous 'Road of Death', only to find themselves deep in bandit country. Disorientation takes them by surprise as they have to navigate Salar de Uyuni - a salt lake so vast that Buzz Aldrin could see it from space. Their goal is the ancient mountain city of Potosi, whose silver mines financed the Spanish empire in the 16th century and which is almost 5,000 metres above sea level.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee, Rhod Gilbert and Ed Byrne join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at pathology, the causal study of disease based on the analysis of bodily fluids. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Stand By Me (1986)
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry, including a challenge involving an egg cup.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, trainee Claire Oates takes her driving test, while chef Alex and manager Michelle prepare a dinner for 130 people on the East Lancashire railway.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the Château de Fontainebleau in France, which began life as a medieval castle in the 12th century before being turned into a renaissance palace in the 1500s.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: A visit to Peles Castle in Romania, which was built in a medieval style in 1914 but is filled with modern technological innovations, including its own hydro-electric power plant.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: The key events of 1943, including the Allied invasion of Sicily, the battle for New Guinea, and the ongoing Soviet fight to regain territory from the Germans.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Examining how the Normandy landings were carried out, with the aid of archive footage.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A labyrinth of tunnels underneath a tiny French village which contains mysteries from several historical eras, and a Welsh slate mine that has been given a new lease of life.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the East Lancashire Railway, the annual Race the Train event gets under way - with athletes of all abilities taking on the 11-mile course from Bury to Rawtenstall.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A severed finger is brought to the Lyell Centre by DCI Rory Goodchild and immigration enforcement officer Pia Butler, who ask Nikki and Thomas to test for a DNA match with 17 year-old Syrian illegal immigrant Akka Khoury. The teenager was sent the digit by a people-smuggler who claims to have her mother and is demanding money for her safe return. Meanwhile, Akka's 12 year-old cousin Sosa is trying to enter the UK illegally hidden in a van on a cross-channel ferry. Emilia Fox stars.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny gives Hugh an ultimatum about their relationship, while Meryl and Betty land Hugh as their star attraction at the first Whyhope speed dating night.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Matt and Charlie's marriage is put to the test when they disagree over Ivy's future, and Hugh's plan to leave Whyhope is scuppered when he is accused of malpractice.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Dorien may have ulterior motives for inviting Tracey to a posh event, while Sharon makes a tidy profit out of fake Rolling Stones T-shirts. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave loses his temper when Donna tells him the truth about their son. Meanwhile, Stubbs struggles with life as an officer. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: B Company's new commander is unimpressed by his men's performances, and Dave's personal problems take their toll.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mickie is still keen to become a doctor, but Mubbs' criticism of her inexperience leaves her questioning her abilities. Jess decides to put her own feelings before her father's wishes, and ends up letting Donna in on her secret, while Owen reassesses his priorities, putting his philandering days firmly behind him and deciding that his future is with Diane and the baby.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack questions the wisdom of Adam's decision to alert the officers to the presence of a serial sniper on the streets of Sun Hill, while undercover journalist Andrea debates whether to cave in to pressure from her editor and deliver a sensationalistic story that could terrify the local population. Steve is unimpressed with Lance's handling of a hostage situation and resorts to extreme measures to express his displeasure.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New CID recruit DC Suzie Sim makes an impressive debut at Sun Hill by speedily solving a hate crime, but also uncovers alarming evidence that Terry's nephew Bradley could be a victim of abuse. Samantha faces an uphill task convincing her colleagues that Abi has been abducted, while Kerry's uncharacteristic waspishness causes concern and Honey's gossiping about her date with Steve backfires.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Trouble brews in the Square as James Wilmott-Brown returns.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Willmott-Brown says he wants to put right a wrong, but will Kathy give him the chance?.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner and Shelagh are at the forefront of the advances in medical technology, and begin a campaign to ensure better respiratory health for their patients. However, Timothy fears their own lifestyle is not good for them and tries to encourage his parents to give up smoking. Violet injures her back and is forced to leave the shop in Fred's hands, a decision that strengthens their relationship but which proves to have other, unforeseen consequences. A new mother's past comes to light, with devastating repercussions for her family. Nurse Crane draws on her own experiences to help her.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is rocked by a series of violent attacks on women, and a prostitute is too ashamed to report what she knows - but her actions lead to a dangerous man roaming the streets, with devastating consequences for the residents of Nonnatus House. A mother tries to keep her daughter's pregnancy a secret to avoid gossip, putting her life in danger. The Turners go on a long overdue holiday, but the weather ruins their plans.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The introduction of the contraceptive pill is welcomed by Dr Turner, but some of his colleagues are less keen on the idea. Patsy tries to help a bargee who wants to give birth among her own community rather than in a maternity ward. Nurse Crane deals with an emergency during a storm, and a familiar face returns to Nonnatus House - but has been changed by her time away.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is horrified to realise he may be partly to blame as the cause of the recent rise in birth deformities comes to light, and tries to prevent further cases. Sister Evangelina returns to work, but has clearly been affected badly by her stroke, and her health continues to deteriorate. A pregnant bride goes into labour during her wedding reception, while her mother is forced to come to terms with her grandchild being conceived out of wedlock.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel wants peace and quiet, but ends up in hospital along with Patrick, Jean and Stephen.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When the father of a young writer is found dead, tensions mount against the travellers in Kembleford, and the priest races to find out who actually committed the murder before one of them is wrongly sent to the gallows. Starring Mark Williams, Nathalie Buscombe and Philip McGinley.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A marine salvage team unearth the legendary Saint Marie silver, but their celebration comes to an abrupt halt when their captain is found dead on the beach with a stab wound to his chest. With the captain's son Sam, wife Naomi and assistant Addison having watertight alibis, attention turns to rival treasure hunter Newton Farrell. Meanwhile, Dwayne is on best man duty as he organises the ultimate stag party for a terrified JP, and Florence is determined to find out what Humphrey got up to the night before his own wedding. Caribbean crime drama, guest starring Jack Donnelly (Atlantis) and Jill Halfpenny (Humans).

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A schoolteacher disappears and investigating officer DCI Andy Steemson asks Nikki and Jack to examine evidence found at the house, including traces of blood, bike tracks and a charred cake in the oven. Meanwhile, Thomas is called to the site of the murder of a former drug addict and petty criminal who has been thrown from the top of a flyover, and becomes determined to win justice for the victim in the wake of police indifference - forming an unlikely alliance in the process.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Conman: The Life and Crimes of Mark Acklom
programme.desc: Documentary following the story of a cunning fraudster who posed as an MI6 agent to con his ex-girlfriend out of almost £300,000

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: New Lines
programme.desc: Another chance to see two special reports in our New Lines series. The first is about cocaine use in Britain and the other about a crisis in rural housing.

programme.desc: Alex Crawford joins South African rangers battling rhino poaching and Stuart Ramsay's team face the dangers of filming in the Amazon.

programme.title: A Week in Interviews

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes another batch of celebrity guests to his famous green room for a special Christmas edition of the talk show. He is joined by David Tennant, whose demonic role in Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman's Good Omens will be coming to BBC in the new year, as well as singers Rita Ora and Jamie Cullum, former X Factor judge Sharon Osbourne, Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two presenter Rylan Clark-Neal, award-winning Hollywood star David Oyelowo and comedian Bec Hill.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: The contestants are guaranteed some fine food today as their mystery host is celebrity chef Aldo Zilli. Can he cook up enough cryptic clues to hide his Italian identity or will he be getting out the Fairy Liquid when the diners have all gone home? Brian McFadden plays go-between.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott continues his tour of Jamaica, taking a trip into the Blue Mountains to learn the secrets of the region's famous coffee. He also visits one of the island's most acclaimed jerk chicken establishments and tries to get his hands on their secret recipe, before whipping up a mango and pineapple milkshake at famous hotel Jamaica Inn.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A house-hunting couple are found dead shortly after viewing a supposedly haunted cottage. Locals claim the property is cursed - but Barnaby and Jones soon hear enough to suspect several builders, developers and estate agents of resorting to murder. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with George Baker, Ruth Gemmell and Jane Wymark.

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor (2008)
programme.desc: Daredevil explorers Rick and Evelyn O'Connell are called into action when their son accidentally resurrects the evil Chinese Emperor Han from his ancient tomb. The family now faces a race against time to prevent the merciless leader from awakening his vast terracotta army in a plot to take over the world. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Maria Bello, Jet Li and Michelle Yeoh.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Jack Frost (1998)
programme.desc: A rock musician who realises he is spending too much time away from his family is killed in a car accident while travelling home for the festive season. The following year his spirit takes on the form of a snowman, made by his son, allowing them to spend one last Christmas together. Fantasy drama, starring Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross and Mark Addy.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five wheelchair basketball enthusiasts answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts a special seasonal edition of the quiz, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine in the hope of winning £20,000 for charity. Donning panto outfits to get into the festive spirit - oh yes they do - Lesley Joseph, Vicky Pattison and Christopher Biggins all bid to land their charities a Christmas gift to remember.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Coronation Street stars Simon Gregson, Victoria Ekanoye, Lucy Fallon and Andrew Whyment pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kim tries to get Jamie on side, Rhona worries what people might think, and David's anxiety grows.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Michelle heads to the bistro to hand over the keys to the new owner, but when the mystery buyer turns out to be Ray, she sets about smashing up the place. Elsewhere, Ali reveals that he's told the police about Gary's secret life as a loan shark, and a mortified Fiz confesses to Tyrone and Jade how she bought a gun for the shop, and it was then stolen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a time of joy and happiness in Midsomer for once - Christmas is coming, and DCI Barnaby and his wife Sarah are soon to become parents. But the festive mood changes when a man is stabbed to death with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a spooky manor house in Morton Shallows. Is blacksmith's daughter Rose Wilton seeking revenge from beyond the grave, or will Barnaby and sidekick Charlie Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder? Starring Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee, with Fiona Dolman, Les Dennis, Elizabeth Berrington, Mark Heap, Emily Joyce, James Murray and Hannah Tointon.

programme.title: Love Actually (2003)
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of Kamaz trucks and hair-care products and the construction of Chinese landmark building the Canton Tower.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a budget Nissan Skyline supercar and Edd China sets about transforming it into a home-made drift racer.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons, oversees the clash between The Tank from Gloucester and The Caley Picture House from Edinburgh.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Home-video and surveillance footage of souped-up rides that defy logic, dragster disasters, and a pedestrian who caused mayhem on a highway one night.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Home-grown daredevils take their stunts to the next level. Plus, footage of big-vehicle catastrophes, and police arresting a driver who decided to take a nap on his car.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A blaze at a fireworks factory sparks a massive explosion, two pilots survive a fiery crash-landing on an aircraft carrier, and a car is driven into a restaurant.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A rocket explosion scatters bystanders who fear for their lives, six racing cars are destroyed in a crash on a wet track, and a bull rider is trampled by his animal.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Rumours of new mill restrictions are circulated, and with some tractors still inoperable and a road unfinished, Bobby and his crew are forced to increase production rapidly.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team collaborates with the husband of a Saleen Mustang fanatic, who asks them to give his wife's beloved vehicle a much-needed makeover.

programme.title: Extreme Rides
programme.desc: Engineering, passion and dreams collide to give birth to the world's most exciting vehicles - whether it's the world's fastest production car or a jet powered super truck.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: How did pictures from the Hubble telescope make the comet of the century look like an alien spacecraft? Has earth already been invaded by alien organisms?.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Looking at the mysterious trails on the lunar surface near the Apollo landing sites, as well as a strange space object.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: The documentary series looks into the so-called 'space fireflies', which reportedly attack astronauts' brains.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Looking at an astronaut beginning to drown on a spacewalk, and Nasa's discovery of an asteroid which has been converted into a spacecraft.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Exploring whether Nasa is responsible for a nuclear explosion on Jupiter, and looking at the truth behind the mystery of the iconic face on Mars.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Reports of vanishing aircraft and UFOs have convinced investigators that the government knows more than it admits. The top-secret military base Area 52 may hold the answers.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: For decades UFO research was confined to searching the skies. However, newly declassified documents suggest mysterious submerged objects are the next field of study.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Incredible reports of UFO sightings by pilots and astronauts increase every year and their testimonies have convinced several researchers that Nasa is concealing the truth.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: A contemplation over whether Earth could have been visited by extra-terrestrials in its ancient past. New discoveries suggest contact may have influenced human art and technology.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Ancient art and archaeology suggest mankind has been visited by otherworldly beings. The programme contemplates whether this is proof of contact with aliens since the dawn of man.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: The UFO researchers who believe Nasa is hiding the truth about alien life, questioning whether the deathbed confessions of scientists reveal a history of otherworldly contact.

programme.title: Are We Alone?
programme.desc: Scientists compare the extreme environments of distant worlds with those found in remote areas of Earth, in the hope of gaining new insights in the search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Alien Encounters
programme.desc: More humans try to join the hybrid network with hi-tech tools, and fearing the diminishment of its power, the US launches an attack on the quantum computer.

programme.title: The Strangest UFO Stories of All Time
programme.desc: A look at whether the atomic bomb alerted extra-terrestrial governments to the planet. Are other civilisations now in league with world rulers to control the human imagination?.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A Frenchman with a rare shaking condition and an American woman with an enormous stomach tumour.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In February 2008, Christopher Duncan left his apartment in San Antonio, Texas, and disappeared. Police had little to go on until surveillance footage offered the potential to reveal the identity of a dangerous killer.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A 2009 case in which 27-year-old Jessika Kalaher was found strangled in her car in Texas. With her wallet and car keys missing, detectives turned to security cameras for clues.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary featuring investigations in which natural clues, including insect bites, cat hair and a rare form of bacteria helped forensic scientists solve murders.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The discovery of a unique high-powered rifle which led to the arrest and conviction of a killer responsible for five random murders.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The investigators travel to the city's west side to investigate reports of a dog in distress and find the animal is entangled in wire.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Vet Lisa treats a cat badly injured in a hit-and-run, Chris devises a radical treatment for a bird and Pearl the blind seal undergoes a risky operation to restore her sight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Mike Sorrentino arrives at Kleinfeld to help Melissa find her wedding gown. However, Mike and his brothers steal the spotlight.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Felipe Santos, who vanished in 2003 after police in Naples, Florida, caught him driving illegally. The investigation became more complicated a year later when Terrance Williams vanished from the same area in identical circumstances.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Allison Foy, who went missing in July 2006 after drinks with friends at a bar in North Carolina. Investigators contemplated whether the 34-year-old was trying to escape her stormy marriage or abducted by a predator. The mystery of her disappearance ended two years later when her remains were found in woodland close by the body of another murder victim, but no one was detained in connection with her death.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 42-year-old Patricia Viola, who vanished from her New Jersey home in February 2001, shortly after a routine telephone conversation with her mother. A bone fragment was found locally just over a year later, but it would be a another decade until DNA advancements allowed its identity to be positively confirmed after comparisons were made with samples provided by Viola's two children.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Vermont teenager Brianna Maitland, who vanished after leaving her family's farm after dropping out of high school, intent on getting her life back on track. Four days after the 17-year-old was last seen by friends in March 2004, her slightly damaged car was recovered from outside an abandoned farmhouse.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of US Army veteran and mother-of-three Margaret Haddican-McEnroe, who disappeared from her New Jersey home in October 2006 leaving her five-month-old baby in its cot.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-four Amber Gerweck who went missing in April 2011. Her car was found in Georgia, 600 miles from her home, and when Amber eventually reappeared she claimed to have no recollection of events over the previous three weeks.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits one of his favourite houses and discovers a design classic, and later visits a museum in a giant windmill.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a manor house in Oxfordshire, where the classic exterior hides a weird and wonderful interior in which he hopes to uncover some priceless gems.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to an antiques shop in Edinburgh on a hunt for new stock, and on an expedition to a 750-year-old house, he discovers an item that takes him out of his comfort zone.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: When architectural salvage hunter Drew Pritchard and his sidekick Tee gain access to a recently closed department store, they face a potentially almighty shopping spree.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Top salvage expert Drew Pritchard breaks new ground with his first-ever buying trip to Northern Ireland, where he gets 'trollied' and falls for a vintage Japanese item.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Architectural salvage expert Drew Pritchard visits a stately home in Barnstaple, where he tries to charm Lady Arran. Then, he finds plenty of neon treats in Bournemouth.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: Do I Call Him My Son?
programme.desc: A woman searches for her brother, hoping to fulfil a promise she made to her late mother. Her discovery blows open a 40-year-old family secret.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: If You Bring Your Baby Home, You Can't Come Home
programme.desc: Forty-six years after placing her daughter for adoption, a woman still carries the feeling of guilt for being an unwed mother.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Karina, whose weight placed a burden on her parents after she became unable to care for herself. The hope remains that it is not too late for her to repair the damage to her body.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Following the life of Lizzie Velasquez who has a disorder that stops her body from storing fat. Plus, more incredible human stories.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: My Baby Has Two Heads: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A baby in India is born with an extra head, doctors operate on a large neck tumour, and a teenager is diagnosed with a rare ageing condition.
